Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2012 02:16PM BucsGirl4Life wrote: Awesome news Drewmom!  Good idea to follow up with your BS for confirmation too!  The 22nd seems like a lifetime.  When I had the biopsy and they told me it would be 5 to 10 business days before I would have the results, I wanted to cry.  I hadn't been able to eat hardly anything the week before the biopsy because I was a nervous wreck.  The fact that the doctor says it "looks" benign to her, makes the waiting a little easier.
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2012 04:36PM BucsGirl4Life wrote: Update!  Just got the call from my BS and they received my results quicker than they expected.  B9!!!  Fibroadenoma!  I am sooo very happy!   Just want to thank everyone that was so encouraging the last couple of weeks!  There's no need for me to take up your valuable time with anymore posts, but know I am inspired by what strong women you are and will keep you in my prayers!  XOXO
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2012 03:41PM BucsGirl4Life wrote: I'll join you too!  I'm still waiting for the results from my core biopsy.  My birad was a 4 for both ultrasound and mammo, but when the BS did the biopsy, she said it was a solid mass, but also said she was hopeful that it was a fibroadenoma, but couldn't be 100%.  When I did my research on FA, it says smooth borders and typically are found in women in their 20's and 30's, whereas mine had irregular borders and I'm 45.  Anyway, I don't get my results until the 22nd.  Sending you both positive thoughts for B9s!
